author: Mike Hillyard
comment: Like the appearance and seems to be only compass that should work on moto 360 1st gen. However I cannot get the compass to work at all having the 360 stuck on the app display, I have tried restarts and settings but nothing found to fix the issue. Please resolve this and rating will improve. Thanks.

author: Rev. Lauren Maddison
comment: Just had to restart moto 360. Will buy pro version. Also trying to figure out a way to launch it more easily from the watch. It's a little convoluted with the Moto.
title: Works well, just what I needed.

author: Francesco Antognini
comment: This is a nice app that does what it says. Well at least until the marshmallow update on the moto 360 1st gen. The compass is now stuck at 360°. Confident the developer will address this issue.
title: Worked well until marshmallow update.

author: Risto Podvoznjak
comment: Really works after so many crap. And it shows what it showing should. Scouts, couple deegrees its not a problem. LG Urbane Androidwear 2. Hvala covjece! :-)

author: Dedy Irvan
comment: Usually I need a compass to get the sense of position inside a building. This is a great tool for me. Just have to restart my moto 360 before it can run properly. need fix here. but really, just put a warning to restart the watch after instalation should be fine.
title: Simply Works. Looks great on Moto

author: Nigel Brownjohn
comment: These seem unable to play nice.  Which ever gets access first works - but then fails once the other tries to access the compass - at which point the working one also fails.  Symptoms - inaccurate reading in second app, then freezing in first app.  I assume one or both apps are attempting to open sensors exclusively - which would seem weird for a read only operation.  This is an app. issue, not hardware as the sensor carries on reporting movement just fine.  App is basic, but fine.  Update: I am not sure the statement that only one app can get sensor data is correct (may depend on how you are getting the data) as I have two apps gathering step data successfully, also using SensorDashboard (an app) it reports all sensors while they are being used by the other apps.

reply.author: Massive Robotics
reply.content: Hi Mr.Nigel. Thank you for your feedback. The problem you are facing is related with Wear OS. Operating system does not send sensor feedback to multiple apps. Not related with CompassX. Please re consider giving 3 stars. Thanks.

title: Moto 360 Watchmaker / XCompass issues

author: Dave Leonard
comment: May not be a developer issue...watch may not be compatible...Moto hasn't gotten back to me on this yet.
title: Doesn't work with moto360 2015

comment: Looks good but... Unable to calibrate on moto 360.  I tried exactly as it is done in the video

reply.content: Thank's for your feedback, please contact us through our mail address below the page, we will be happy to help you.

comment: Didn't work until I restarted My phone and watch , works well on moto 360 .

author: T.W. Cook
comment: This app is attractive, easy to read, and surprisingly accurate. It is critical that you calibrate the compass - to do that, just start the app, and move your watch in a figure 8 pattern a few times. I am using it on Sony Smartwatch 3.

reply.author: Massive Robotics
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback appreciated.

comment: Tried another compass app which didn't work on my LG G Watch R but this one works great. Easy to calibrate and use.

reply.author: Massive Robotics
reply.content: Hi Maurice, Thanks for your feedback. Can't explain the joy we have when we see a happy user. Have fun.

reply.author: Massive Robotics
reply.content: Hi Frederic, Thanks for your feedback, As it is stated at the beginning of the video, that application is paid version of this app called ToolX, Please consider giving 5 stars each rating is very important for us. I hope this helps, thank your.

author: chasemoss
comment: Worked flawless / i didnt even need to calibrate!  *****Dev my only request would be color options. Something configurable on your phone.*****

reply.content: Thanks for rating, we are working on pro version of CompassX, it will be more than just a compass, we will include color option too.

title: Perfection on Moto360

author: André Garcia
comment: Nice design, and I'm sure it would be a great app, but it would never calibrate even after moving on a figure 8 pattern multiple times.

reply.author: Massive Robotics
reply.content: Hi André, Thanks for your feedback. Calibration is very easy, open the app spin the watch around 360 degrees a few times till you see numbers changing rapidly. I hope this helps, please reconsider giving us 2 stars, please rate as 5 stars, we need that. Thanks.

author: Michael T.
comment: Never installed on my Android Wear device after waiting ~20-30 minutes, even after I told Android Wear to manually sync apps.

reply.author: Massive Robotics
reply.content: Hello Michael, please contact us before giving 1 star. This is a know issue for Wear OS. Nothing related with the app since this app has over 25.000 active user.

author: John Fisher
comment: It doesn't work on the Moto 360 because the watch has no compass evidently.  The description doesn't say that, as other apps of this kind do, and it is shown on a Moto 360 which may be a first gen device. Also, it seems to work on the phone, but jut has one screen and no way to calibrate it or do anything other than turn it on and off.
